TopicTitle: Collider node found, but no mesh in it

Articles.Content:
Could anybody please explain to me why this model with textures on all of it's parts gives this error.

Here is the part:

http://www./?hf78amg5lf88kim

here is the .max file:

http://www./?hqv4xg3cx66mgdd

I was getting this error when I had the texture path in MAX set to the psd file instead of the png. I don't know how that could cause this but that's the only thing I changed, re-exported, and it worked.

This error is thrown when the loader can't process the collider node's mesh. That can happen for several reasons, but the most likely one is that your collision mesh is lacking a material.

The DAE model importer requires all meshes to have materials. Even the ones that aren't visible in the game. Later, the collider's material is discarded, but if the mesh didn't have one to start with, it'll crash the model importer.

[mod]Also, I think this thread would fit in better at the Addon Development Forums [/mod]

Hope this helps,

Cheers
The mesh has to be assigned the right material, and has to be named 'node_collider'. Not satisfying both requirements produces that error for me.
I am getting the same error and all objects fit the requirements I have heard. Anyone have any Ideas?

reset xform

I\'m using Cinema 4D to model, there is no xform setting.
cant help yea there then. i had this problem yesterday and a reset xform fixed it.
